A.definition: What word means using technology to make processes automatic, helping us deliver net price guidance?
What process helps us understand data to make better pricing decisions?

B.definition: In our strategy, we aim to make net sales and GP1 what?
What represents our company identity and product recognition?

C.definition: Which promo mechanic gives a direct price discount to consumers?
Who is the end user of our products?

D.definition: What reduction in price helps drive sales volume?
What information helps us make informed pricing decisions?

E.definition: What word describes how much the quantity sold changes when the price changes?
A term for profit after subtracting all costs?

F.definition: A price is what when it is competitive in the market?
What prediction helps us plan future sales and pricing?

G.definition: What word refers to our Net Revenue Management colleagues who define the tools at the worldwide level?
What increase do we aim for in our business metrics?

H.definition: A special intense focus on a category or customer?
What type of strategy combines multiple approaches?

I.definition: A metric comparing prices to competitors?
What drives new solutions and improvements in our processes?

J.definition: What word describes the continued increase in GP1 over the last years?
What path do customers take from awareness to purchase?

K.definition: What expertise helps us make better business decisions?

L.definition: What word means to use your strengths or resources to get an advantage?
What do we do when introducing a new product to market?

M.definition: The expected profit from a sale?
Where do we compete and sell our products?

N.definition: What does our department specialize in? (Net Revenue...)

O.definition: What word means the requests customers make to buy products, helping build our sales?
What process makes our pricing and promotions more effective?

P.definition: A temporary price reduction to boost sales?
What strategy determines how much customers pay?

Q.definition: What word means how good our brands and products are, helping keep consumers loyal?
What three-month period do we use for business reporting?

R.definition: What total income do we generate from sales?
What metric measures return on investment?

S.definition: What word means the area or range you look at to understand something?
What plan guides our long-term business decisions?

T.definition: What word means a group of people working together to achieve a goal?
What goal or objective do we aim to achieve?

U.definition: Raising the perceived value of a product?
What individual item do we measure in sales volume?

V.definition: What word do we use for the process of making our brands worth a higher price?
What quantity measurement is key to our sales success?

W.definition: What word means sales happening every seven days?
What do we aim to do in competitive situations?

X.definition: What word means coming from outside or not inside?
(Contains X) What standard of quality do we strive for?

Y.definition: What word means sales happening every year?
What return or profit do we generate from our investments?

Z.definition: What word means the point where costs and revenues are equal, so no profit or loss?
What geographic or market area do we focus on?
